roleset.name: to come into conflict, be in opposition
roleset.note: CLASH-V NOTES: VerbNet classes battle-36.4-1. (from clash.01-v)

CLASH-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry clash.01, OntoNotes grouping clash-n senses 2& 4; maps to VerbNet classes battle-36.4-1, bump-18.4-1, sound_emission-43.2. Framed by Claire. (from clash.01-n)

role.descr: 1st, all in one mention, or agentive clasher
entity clashed with when separat constituent

example.name: transitive
example.text: A successor was n't named [*-1] , which [*T*-35]fueled speculation that Mr. Bernstein may have clashed with S.I. Newhouse Jr. , whose family company , Advance Publications Inc. , [*T*-2] owns Random House .
example.arg: with S.I. Newhouse Jr. , whose family company , Advance Publications Inc. , [*T*-2] owns Random House

example.name: all arguments
example.text: Mr. Azoff reportedly was bored and frequently clashed with top MCA management over a number of issues such as compensation and business plans .
example.arg: over a number of issues such as compensation and business plans

example.name: Arg 1 as "with" PP
example.text: Both executives left the company after clashes with ChairmanRalph Ingersoll Jr .

example.name: NP only, Arg0, both clashers in single constituent
example.text: such a clash of corporate titans

example.name: Arg2, LOC & MNR
example.text: There was a bitter clash in the senate over the proposed health care bill.
example.arg: over the proposed health care bill

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Remember her clash with the bishops over the condom issue?

roleset.name: (cause to) emit a clashing noise, or cause discord between two non-agentive things
roleset.note: CLASH-V NOTES: Frames file for 'clash' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from clash.02-v predicate notes)
CLASH-N NOTES: Roleset based on OntoNotes grouping senses 1& 3, no equivalent PB verb entry; maps to VN classes bump-18.4-1, sound_emission-43.2. Framed by Claire. (from clash.02-n)

roles.note: This roleset can *almost* be included with .01, except for usages like "he clashed the symbol against the other," where we have an agent and two clasher constituents...Plus this sense will never have a "topic" argument. (from clash.02-n)

role.descr: agent, one causing a clashing noise
location, thing that the theme clashes against

example.name: Theme as subject
example.text: As the drum set fell over, the cymbals clashed against the floor.
example.arg: As the drum set fell over

example.name: With agent as subject, from google
example.text: He has clashed the cymbals and banged the drums.

example.name: Arg1, both clashers in one mention
example.text: The clash of the symbols could be heard above the rest of the orchestra.

example.name: New semantics, Arg1 as one PP again
example.text: The clash between John's plaid pants and paisley shirt was unflattering.
example.arg: between John's plaid pants and paisley shirt

example.name: Args 1 & 2
example.text: The clash of steel against shield, crackling magics cast by wizards, arcane Dwarven technology, sinister Skaven, and many more!
